drug.name: Hemin
drug.description: Hemin (trade name Panhematin) is an iron-containing porphyrin. More specifically, it is protoporphyrin IX containing a ferric iron ion (heme B) with a chloride ligand.
drug.indication: Used in the management of porphyria attacks, particularly in acute intermittent porphyria.

drug-interaction.name: Lepirudin
drug-interaction.description: Hemin may increase the anticoagulant activities of Lepirudin.

drug-interaction.description: Hemin may increase the anticoagulant activities of Bivalirudin.
